path: Boxes/Temple College Nursing Program/LVN Program/Fall 24/MED-SURG/Documents/Module VIII/Module VIII Objectives.pdf
text: Temple College Vocational Nursing Program VNSG 1409: Nursing in Health and Illness II Module VIII Objectives Upon completion of this module the student will be able to: Care of clients in shock: Chapter 9 1. Define the 4 different types of shock: hypovolemic, cardiogenic, obstructive, and distributive shock. 2. Discuss the signs and symptoms, complications, treatment variations and nursing care for each type of shock. 3. Identify positive outcome criteria for clients with shock. Care of the surgical client: Chapter 12, 37 Williams 1. Explain the nature of informed consent and related nursing responsibilities. 2. Describe the nursing care for the client in the perioperative phase. 3. Identify the types of clients most at risk for surgical complications and explain why each type is at risk.
